subtasks.description: Traverse the `experiments/` directory and list all experiment sub‑directories whose modification time is older than 24 hours. Write the full paths to a file `older_dirs.txt`.
subtasks.acceptance_criteria: A file `older_dirs.txt` exists and contains one absolute path per line for every experiment directory older than 24 hours. No directories from today are included.

subtasks.description: For each directory listed in `older_dirs.txt`, inspect its contents to decide if it holds useful output. Useful output is defined as at least one non‑empty file that is not an exact duplicate of a file in another experiment directory (use a hash‑based duplicate check). Produce two files: `useful_dirs.txt` (paths to keep) and `duplicate_or_empty_dirs.txt` (paths to delete).
subtasks.acceptance_criteria: `useful_dirs.txt` contains only directories with unique, non‑empty files. `duplicate_or_empty_dirs.txt` contains directories that are either empty or contain only files duplicated elsewhere. Both files are newline‑separated lists of absolute paths.

subtasks.description: Delete every directory listed in `duplicate_or_empty_dirs.txt`. Record each successful deletion (or any failure) in `deletion_log.txt`.
subtasks.acceptance_criteria: All directories in `duplicate_or_empty_dirs.txt` are removed from the filesystem. `deletion_log.txt` lists each deleted path and any errors encountered.

subtasks.description: Calculate and report the pruning results: number of directories deleted, number kept, and total bytes freed by the deletions. Write a concise summary to `prune_summary.txt`.
subtasks.acceptance_criteria: `prune_summary.txt` contains three lines: `Deleted: X directories`, `Kept: Y directories`, `Bytes freed: Z bytes`. Numbers reflect the actual state after deletion.
